project2adv

Class Credit

  • java.lang.Object
    • project2adv.Account
      • project2adv.Credit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccountInfo, TransactionHandler

    public class Credit
extends Account
    The Credit class represents a credit account with an assigned credit limit. It extends the Account class, overriding methods to handle unique credit account behaviors, such as withdrawal constraints based on credit limits and deposits specifically for outstanding balance repayment.

    This class allows for viewing credit account details, charging to the credit account, and making deposits to reduce outstanding balances.

    See Also:
    Account

        public Credit(java.lang.String accountNum,
              double accountBal,
              double credLimit)
        Constructs a new Credit account with the specified account number, initial balance, and credit limit.
        Parameters:
        accountNum - the account number to assign to this credit account
        accountBal - the initial balance of the credit account
        credLimit - the credit limit assigned to this account

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw(double amount,
                     java.lang.String customerName,
                     boolean logTransaction)
        Withdraws (charges) a specified amount to the credit account, as long as it does not exceed the credit limit. The transaction can be optionally logged.
        Specified by:
        withdraw in interface TransactionHandler
        Overrides:
        withdraw in class Account
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to charge, must be positive and within credit limit
        customerName - the name of the customer making the charge
        logTransaction - flag indicating if the transaction should be logged
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is non-positive or exceeds the available credit limit

      • deposit

        public void deposit(double amount,
                    java.lang.String customerName,
                    boolean logTransaction)
        Deposits a specified amount to the credit account to reduce the outstanding balance. Deposits that exceed the negative balance (overpayment) are not allowed.
        Specified by:
        deposit in interface TransactionHandler
        Overrides:
        deposit in class Account
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to deposit, must be positive and not exceed outstanding balance
        customerName - the name of the customer making the deposit
        logTransaction - flag indicating if the transaction should be logged
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is non-positive or exceeds the outstanding balance
